page.title: 16FARMING
page.content: Low Peasholmes farm is a dairy farm. The shippen holds 56 cows. There is one bull. There are three tractors, two of which are John Deeres. The other is a Massey Ferguson. The farmer and his son get up at 5.30am to milk the cows. Then they feed the calves on milk and maize. The cows eat cow cake. They have 4 barns, 1 holds machinery the others hold potatoes and hay. They are building a new barn to hold the combine harvester. The farm is 126 acres in size. They have half an acre potatoes, 18 acres of barley and the rest is grazing. There is a corndrill, manure drill, much spreader, hay baler, rotarator, crop sprayer and two barley bins on the farm. The farmhouse was rebuilt in 1900. The age of the original farm house is not known.
